newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Konsortium sees 33 pct air cargo turnove.
newsitem.headline: Konsortium sees 33 pct air cargo turnove.

text.p: Malaysian shipping and transport firm Konsortium Perkapalan Bhd said on Monday it expected air cargo to contribute around 33 percent of group turnover by the year 2001.
"I expect the air cargo side to provide around a third of the contribution to turnover by 2001," group executive chairman Mirzan Mahathir told a news conference.
Mirzan said air cargo's current contribution to group turnover was "not significant."
Mirzan was speaking after the launch of CEN Worldwide Sdn Bhd, a 20-percent owned express cargo firm.
Konsortium's turnover for the year to December 31, 1996 stood at 454.67 million ringgit, against 100.79 million ringgit the previous year.
CEN's other partners are postal utility Pos Malaysia Bhd, which owns 42.5 percent of the equity, while Transmile Group Bhd holds 37.5 percent.
Mirzan is also chairman of Transmile, and is the eldest son of Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad.

"CEN Worldwide Sdn Bhd will be providing express transport services including door-to-door deliveries, express freight handling, warehousing, logistic technologies and management expertise in these areas," said a CEN statement.
